column4: i'm getting half the transfer rate i should be getting with my hard drive :(
16MB/s and i *know* this drive can do 33MB/s
i don't know if it has to do with immature chipset support in the kernel or what
it's an ati chipset
and that's on the 2.6.11 kernel
2.6.10 gives me .5MB/s with hdparm
takes about 8 minutes to boot up :)
DMA setting perhaps?
no, DMA is on
unless you are saying maybe dma needs to be fine tuned?
no, meant enabling. :)
nah it's enabled
if i try to enable it when using the 2.6.10 kernel the command to enable dma doesn't work
what's the error?
i'd have to boot back into 2.6.10 to see
er, nvm
386 or 686 kernel?
i heard of someone having hjis 2gb only recognised as 700 using the 386
dunno, can't really think of anything else sorry
freezing usually indicates a display driver issue
